metadata.Title: CVE-2021-26691 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0 to 2.4.46 a specially crafted SessionHeader sent by an origin server could cause a heap overflow

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26691` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.16').
